page.title: 01Barrington village
page.content: The main part of the village of Barrington covers approximately one square kilometre. The main street is a minor tarmaced road. There is a pathway down the full length of the south side of the street. The notrth side is bordered by the greens - 22 acres in size. Barrington is a striking village grouped round the greens. This has been encroached upon by the island of 17th century thatched cottages, houses near the church, houses and gardens along the river. Until recently there were traces of earthworks on the green resembling the platforms of gardens. All Saints church is a 11-14th century church with a square tower. Several medieaval paintings have been uncovered on the walls of the nave.
